turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Damn skippy, you're not! You don't even remember to give Liberty Bell her breathing meds.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Once! And she didn't die, if you recall!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I thought you were the kind of girl who knew when to say when.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I have no idea what kind of girl I am.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: She's joking. Junebug has a wonderful sense of humor, which is just one of her many genetic gifts.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I also have good teeth. No cavities. We finally got fluoridated water in Dancing Elk.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Well, no... I'm not going to sell the baby. I just want it to grow up with people who are ready to love it and be parents. I'm in high school, dude. I'm ill-equipped.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Hi Dad.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Hey, big puffy version of Junebug. Where have you been?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Dealing with stuff way beyond my maturity level. Where is everyone?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Bren took Liberty Bell to her tot ice skating class.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Tot ice skating? Tots can't ice skate. Liberty Bell's still getting the hang of stairs.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: No, but you know Bren. She dreams big.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah, she does.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You look a little morose, honey. What's eating you?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'm losing my faith in humanity.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Think you can narrow it down for me.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I guess I wonder sometimes if people ever stay together for good.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You mean like couples?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah, like people in love.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Are you having boy trouble? I gotta be honest; I don't much approve of you dating in your condition, 'cause... well, that's kind of messed up.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Dad, no!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Well, it's kind of skanky. Isn't that what you girls call it? Skanky? Skeevy?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Please stop now.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Tore up from the floor up?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Dad, it's not about that. I just need to know that it's possible for two people to stay happy together forever. Or at least for a few years.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's not easy, that's for sure. Now, I may not have the best track record in the world, but I have been with your stepmother for ten years now, and I'm proud to say that we're very happy.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I sort of already have.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Well, of course. Your old D-A-D! You know I'll always be there to love and support you, no matter what kind of pickle you're in.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Either I just pissed my pants or...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Or...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Thundercats are go!

turns.speaker: ROLLO
turns.text: Well, well. If it isn't MacGuff the Crime Dog! Back for another test?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I think the last one was defective. The plus sign looked more like a division sign.

turns.speaker: ROLLO
turns.text: Maybe you're having twins. Maybe your little boyfriend's got mutant sperms and he knocked you up twice!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Silencio! I just drank my weight in Sunny D. and I have to go, pronto.

turns.speaker: ROLLO
turns.text: Well, you know where the lavatory is.  You pay for that pee stick when you're done! Don't think it's yours just because you've marked it with your urine!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Jesus, I didn't say it was.

turns.speaker: ROLLO
turns.text: Well, it's not. You're not a lion in a pride!  These kids, acting like lions with their unplanned pregnancies and their Sunny Delights.

turns.speaker: ROLLO
turns.text: So what's the prognosis, Fertile Myrtle? Minus or plus?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I don't know. It's not... seasoned yet. Wait. Huh. Yeah, there's that pink plus sign again. God, it's unholy.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Yo-yo-yiggity-yo.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I am a suicide risk.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Is this Juno?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No it's Morgan Freeman. Got any bones that need collecting?

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Only the one in my pants.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Dude, I'm pregnant.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Maybe it's just a food baby. Did you have a big lunch?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: It's not a food baby. I took three pregnancy tests today. I am definitely up the spout.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: How did you even generate enough pee for three pregnancy tests?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I drank like ten tons of Sunny Delight. Anyway, yeah. I'm pregnant. And you're shockingly cavalier.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Is this for real? Like for real, for real?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Unfortunately, yes.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Oh my God! Oh shit! Phuket Thailand!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: That's the kind of emotion I was looking for in the first take.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Well, are you going to go to Havenbrooke or Women Now for the abortion? You need a note from your parents for Havenbrooke.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I know. Women Now, I guess. The commercial says they help women now.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Want me to call for you? I called for Becky last year.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Eh, I'll call them myself. But I do need your help with something very urgent.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Heavy lifting can only help you at this point.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: That is sick, man.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: So, you were bored? Is that how this blessed miracle came to be?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Nah, it was a premeditated act. The sex, I mean, not getting pregnant.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: When did you decide you were going to do Bleeker?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Like, a year ago, in Spanish class.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Aha! You love him.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: It's extremely complicated, and I'd rather not talk about it in my fragile state.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: So, what was it like humping Bleeker's bony bod?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: It was magnificent, man!

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: What are you doing here, dumbass? I thought I was supposed to pick you up at four.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I couldn't do it, Leah! It smelled like a dentist in there. They had these really horrible magazines, with, like, spritz cookie recipes and bad fiction and water stains, like someone read them in the tub. And the receptionist tried to give me these weird condoms that looked like grape suckers, and she told me about her boyfriend's pie balls, and Su-Chin Kuah was there, and she told me the baby had fingernails. Fingernails!

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Oh, gruesome. I wonder if the baby's claws could scratch your vag on the way out?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'm staying pregnant, Le.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Keep your voice down dude, my mom's around here somewhere. She doesn't know we're sexually active.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: What does that even mean? Anyway, I got to thinking on the way over. I was thinking maybe I could give the baby to somebody who actually likes that kind of thing. You know, like a woman with a bum ovary or something. Or some nice lesbos.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: But then you'll get huge. Your chest is going to milktate. And you have to tell everyone you're pregnant.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I know. Maybe they'll canonize me for being so selfless.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Maybe they'll totally shit and be super mad at you and not let you graduate or go to Cabo San Lucas for spring break.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Bleeker and I were going to go to Gettysburg for spring break.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Well, maybe you could look at one of those adoption ads. I see them all the time in the Penny Saver.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: There are ads? For parents?

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Oh yeah! "Desperately Seeking Spawn." They're right by the ads for like, iguanas and terriers and used fitness equipment. It's totally legit.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Come on, Leah. I can't scope out wannabe parents in the Penny Saver! That's tacky. That's like buying clothes at the Pump n' Munch.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: The Penny Saver sucks.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Yeah, but it sucks for free.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Look at this one "Wholesome, spiritually wealthy couple have found true love with each other."  "All that's missing is your bastard."

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: There's a guy in here who's giving away a piano. Free for the hauling! We should put it in Bleeker's yard.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: You're not listening to me.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No, I heard you. I just can't give the baby to people who describe themselves as "wholesome." I'm looking for something a little edgier.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: What did you have in mind, a family of disturbed loners who are into gunplay and incest?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I was thinking a graphic designer, mid-thirties, and his cool Asian wife who dresses awesome and plays bass. But I'm trying to not be too particular.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: All right, how about this one? "Healthy, educated couple seeking infant to join our family of five. You will be compensated. Help us complete the circle of love."

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeesh, they sound like a cult. Besides, they're greedy bitches. They already have three kids!

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Hey, Juno. Juno! Look at this one.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Best to just tell them, man. Rip off the Band-Aid and let it bleed.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'm pregnant.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Check out Baby Big-Head. That kid is scary!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Hey, I'm a sacred vessel. All you've got in your belly is Taco Bell!

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Touche.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: It is really weird looking. It's like it's not even real. I can't believe there are saps who actually cry at these things.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Aw, please Junebug?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No way. No, I definitely don't want to know.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: How do you know I'm so poisonous? Like, what if the adoptive parents turn out to be evil molesters?

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Or stage parents!

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Yum. This pretzel tastes like a friggin' donut!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Share the love, Tits!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Hly shht!

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: That's her. That's Vanessa Loring.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Of the Penny Saver Lorings?

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: No way! She's pretty.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: You sound shocked or something.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: I just thought she'd look really old in real life.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: She's gonna steal that kid for her collection.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Right, seriously.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I want a huge cookie. And like, a lamb kebob. Simultaneously.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: God, Spermy. Must you always feed?

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: God, you're getting huge. How many months has it been now?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Almost eight. You wouldn't believe how weird I look naked.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: I wish my funbags would get bigger.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Trust me, you don't. I actually have to wear a bra now. And I have to rub this nasty cocoa butter stuff all over myself or my skin could get stretched too far and explode.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Hot!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: God, why is everyone always staring at me?

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Well, you are kind of... convex.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Wow, someone's been actually doing her geometry homework for once!

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: I don't have a choice. Keith's been grading me really hard lately.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Please do not refer to Mr. Conyers as "Keith," okay? My barf reflex is already heightened these days.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Keith's hot.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Eww, he's all beardy!

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Did you hear Bleek is going to prom with Katrina De Voort?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Katrina? Pfft, no way. He doesn't like Katrina. It must be a pity date.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: He asked her. I heard they were going to Benihana, then the prom, then to Vijay's parents' cabin.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Bleeker told me Katrina's whole house reeks of soup!

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Oh, it totally does. I was there for her birthday about four years ago and it was like Lipton Landing. But you know, boys have endured worse things for nookie.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: There's no way in hell they're having sex or even holding hands.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: I wouldn't be so sure about that. He did it with you. He's a man now.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah, well, Bleek trusted me. We're best friends.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Are you jealous? I thought you said you didn't care what he did.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'm not jealous, and I don't care. I just know he doesn't like Katrina and I don't think he should toy with her emotions like that. She seems so nice and all.

turns.speaker: LEAH
turns.text: Okay Juno, I'm really convinced.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Prom is for wenises, anyway. Once you're old enough to go, it's not cool anymore.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Hello. Thank you for having me and my irresponsible child over to your home.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Oh no. Thank you. Come on in.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You don't say.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Well, haven't you ever felt like you were born to do something?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Yes. Heating and air conditioning.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Well, I was born to be a mother. Some of us are.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: So. What's that thing?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: A Pilates machine?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: What do you make with that?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: You don't make anything. It's for exercising.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Obviously, we'll compensate you for your medical expenses.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Are you looking for any other compensation?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: You're doing an amazing and selfless thing for us.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Vanessa has wanted a baby since we got married.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I want to be a mommy so badly!

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: You guys are playing music?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Juno just wanted a closer look at Kimber here.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: What do you think? Custard or Cheesecake?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: They're yellow.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Well, I wanted to pick something gender-neutral for now. Once we get the baby, God willing, we can create a more decisive palette.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Why do people think yellow is gender- neutral? I don't know one man with a yellow bedroom.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I think I'm leaning toward Custard in this light. I don't know. I should paint a small area...

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Or you could just wait a couple months. It's not like the baby's going to storm in here any second and demand dessert-colored walls.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: What to Expect says that readying the baby's room is an important process for women. It's called "nesting."

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Nesting, huh? Are you planning to build the crib out of twigs and saliva?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: You should read the book. I even flagged the "daddy chapters" for you.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I just think it's too early to paint. That's my opinion.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: And I disagree.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: That wall is going to need something. Maybe we could put our first family picture there.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Hm.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Can you see it?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Juno, what's the matter?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: She's hormonal. Right, June? It's just part of the whole process.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: What did you do?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I didn't do anything... I just... I've just been thinking.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Just thinking if this is really the right thing for us.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: What are you referring to?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I've been just wondering if we're, you know, ready.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Of course we're ready. We've taken all the classes. The nursery. The books --

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I know we're prepared. I just don't know if... I'm ready.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Why don't we let Juno go home and we can discuss this later on, okay?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: It all just happened so fast. We put that ad in the paper. I thought it would take months if, you know, ever and then -- boom -- Two weeks later, she's in our living room.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: She answered our prayers.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Ever since, it's just been like a ticking clock.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: What would be a good time for you?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I don't know. There's just things I still want to do.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Like what? Be a rock star?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Don't mock me.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I called Gerta Rauss. She says she can represent both of us. They call it "collaborative divorce." It's apparently all the rage right now. And it's easy because we don't have children.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: No, it's fine. Thanks for making the call, I guess.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: We're actually, finally doing this?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Looks like it, yeah.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Have you found a place to stay?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Yeah, downtown.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: A hotel?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: It's a loft.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Aren't you the cool guy?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Me neither. How 'bout you Carrie?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: You lose!

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: I suppose anything's possible.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: ...You can forget about 'em forever and then look at 'em and they're doin' even better than before.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Adele... we gotta do something before Early kills someone else.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: ...There ain't nothin' can kill 'em. They can live for two even three hundred years.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Adele for god sake please lis...

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: There ain't nothing we could do. Once Early sets his mind on somethin', well thats the end of that.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Hi, I'm Adele.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Carrie.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: ...Pardon?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: ...I said, I like your hair.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: ...Thank you.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: One night we figured out how much bad luck he must have comin' from all them mirrors he broke...  Four hundred and ninety four years to work it all off... After he dies, he'll have to keep coming back to earth over and over and over...

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Karma.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Karma...  You know, if you do something bad to somebody fate will pay you back by something bad happening to you.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: That French ain't it?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Are you takin' the pictures?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: ...Yeah.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Is it hard to learn?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Not really.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: You wouldn't have any color film, would ya?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: ...Yeah, sure.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: You dropped this.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Early Grayce if this ain't your lucky day.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Early don't think women should smoke or curse or drink liquor.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: So you don't do any of those things.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Better not, or Early'd whip me.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: He whips you?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: ...Hey you're good. Thought you said you never played before?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: I haven't... I'm a fast learner.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: I told you how Early feels 'bout a woman drinking.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: How'd you meet Early?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: You know I can fix that haircut for you, if you want?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: You can?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: I'm cool.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Could I try that?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: It's a portfolio of my work.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Your pictures. Can I see 'em?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: You took this picture?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Took 'em all.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: That's me.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: No it is not!

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Hold still.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Sorry. Boy I'll tell ya, if Early found a picture of me like that I'd be black and blue for a week.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: You shouldn't let him do that to you...

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Do what?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Adele... are you serious?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: You think Early's bad to me, don't you?

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: My momma's a beautician. Guess that's where I get it from. She wouldn't hear of my moving in with Early... on account of his just getting out of jail and all. Ain't seen her in nearly a year now. I wish she'd call me, just once.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: What's Early been in jail for?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Carryin' a gun.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: ...Anything else?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: An' resistin' arrest... At least that's what the Police said.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Jeez... Adele!

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: The police are after him, he's a murderer!

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: ...That's not true.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: That's not true!

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: ...I wouldn't lie to you, Adele. . . I saw him kill that man.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Early didn't kill nobody, he wouldn't do that. I don't know why you're saying those things. You ain't my friend.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Happy birthday Adele.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Early, you are so sweet.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: I feel kind of like the wizard of oz, you know when she gets the red shoes.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Well Dorothy, why don't you hand me that chili there.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: What's up Adele? Dinner ready?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Almost.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Well... for one thing... They think faster out there, on account of all that warm weather they got; cold weather makes people stupid, that's a fact.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: I guess that'd explain why there's so many stupid people around here.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Yeah, and in California you never have to buy fruit 'cause it's all on the trees everywhere you turn...  ...and, 'course there ain't no speed limit out there, and all drugs are legal... And I heard your first month's rent is free; state law. I figure 'til we get settled we can just move around month to month...

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: What'll we do out there?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Well... the very first thing we're gonna do... is get us a couple of six packs of Lucky Lager and climb up on toppa' that famous Hollywood sign and howl at the moon...

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: You know... I read once... Ain't nothin' on that big old moon 'cept some old golf balls those astronauts left behind.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Bull. That ain't right... Government sends people there all the time, just don't want us to know about it.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Don't be long now, dinner's 'bout ready.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: I heard that.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: What if they're dangerous?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: They ain't dangerous Adele. They're writers.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Did you settle things with Mr. Diebold?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Yeah I left him with the car... We're all squared up now.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Geez, they look kinda weird.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: You just smile, let me do all the talking.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: How many times you gonna tell me that?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: As many times as it takes.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Shush, Adele.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Early, can we stop there... just for a little while.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Can you believe thirty bucks for this room... for what? A lumpy mattress, that crummy TV and a crapper.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Early, sing me a song.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Early, what're you doin'?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Go back to the car and keep Brian there. I don't want him in here...  Do it Adele... Now!

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: What the hell is this stuff?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: It's Chinese food. It was the only place open. You said you was starving, you'd eat anyth...

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Yeah but, what is it?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: I don't know, they didn't speak too good English.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: ...thank you.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Thank you for what?  What are you thanking me for Adele?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: ...I don't know.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Well Adele... it was for...  ...saving your fucking life back there!

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: What's wrong with her?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: She had a dream that somethin' like this was gonna happen.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Nobody wants to hurt you Peaches!

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Early! Stop!!

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Oh, n'jus what in hell you crying 'bout? I'm the one got hit.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: I changed my mind, Early. I'm not gonna climb up that Hollywood sign with you... I decided. I think your mean, and you hurt people.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: What's your name, boy?

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: Walter Livesy.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Think. I might just have to kill you Walter. How do you feel about that?

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: Not so good. You sure you have to?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: I don't know. Wish I did.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Where you from Walter?

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: Vernon, Florida.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Never heard of it, any huntin'?

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: Turkey mostly.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Turkey's are real smart. Smarter than most people think...

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: ...Mind if I hold that Bible?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: What do you need a Bible for?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: You think I'm goin' to kill you. Well that'd make me a liar then wouldn't it?

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: No sir.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Tight fit.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Best kind.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Uh, we can stop somewhere if you and Adele haven't had time for breakfast, Early.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Well, it's like this, Mr. Kessler.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Brian.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Well, it's like this, Bri'. I don't eat much in the mornin', never have. Maybe a beer once in a while; Lucky Lager's my favorite.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: So what do you do Early?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Oh... I do some work up at the Merrick Mirror factory, or I used to...

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: You gonna talk to the people who did those murders?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: That's a good idea. Unfortunately most of them have been executed.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: ...Too bad.

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Can't hurt.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: How much do I owe you?

turns.speaker: EARLY
turns.text: Forget it.
